long: Meaning: properly, "separation"; by implication, a "part" of the body, "branch" of a tree, "bar" for carrying; figuratively, "chief" of a city; especially (with prepositional prefix) as an adverb, "apart", "only", "besides".  Usage: alone, apart, bar, besides, branch, by self, of each alike, except, only, part, staff, strength.  Source: from "H909";
